comments:
Description:
NullPointerException throws out when create a cascading parameter.

Steps to reproduce:
1.Create a sqlserver datasource, the connection url 
is "jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://spmdb:1433/test".
2.Create a dataset, the sql statement is "select * from dbo.client", set a 
filter as "clientid <= 15".
3.Create a cascading parameter,bind with the dataset. select "ClientID" as the 
first level param, "SalesRepID" as the child level param.
4.Error message pops up.


Error log:

Use getParameters() instead of getAllParameters().

Reuse a parameter using extend reference instead of direct refenrence.
Direct reference types include DataSet/DataSource/Style etc.

According to the library function specs, all the parameter in the library 
included are available in the report design.

Anyway, NPE is not expected in any case.

Parameters defined in a library represent reusable definitions. Such 
parameters don?t appear in the report?s ?requester page? unit a report uses 
them. The result uses a reusable parameter by defining a new parameter that 
extends the parameter defined in the library. In most cases, the report design 
simply inherits all characteristics of the reusable parameter.

- I will correct the library spec.
- Agree that if a library is included, doesnt mean all the lib parameters 
automaticallt show up in the requester page.

The expected behavior is
- Library explorer will list all the library parameters
- User can drag lib defined parameters to dataexplorer view
This will create a new pareamter in a report design which is based on lib 
defined parameter.

- First fix the UI
- Next assign to DE team to fix the exception

The UI design has been changed. Now the parameters should be extended from the 
library before used.

Create a pair of cascading parameters in the data explorer, there are four 
parameters listed under the report parameter node.

Expected result:
It should list two cascading parameters.
Which build are you using for verify?

I checked in at 11:30. I know the build which you are using is generated at 
11:00.

Anyway, this appearance is none of business with this bug.
It's unacceptable when create two parameters but list four.
The problem you mentioned has been fixed together.
